Summary Note:
The RM met Schulze Fischer Becker during a business conference in Berlin. They attended several sessions together and realized they shared similar professional goals, leading to a fruitful partnership.
Having worked for over 39 years, Schulze Fischer Becker brings a wealth of experience and expertise to his current role. He is known for his strategic thinking and ability to drive results.
After extensive research, he chose Julius Baer for its strong track record in managing high-net-worth clients.
Family Background: Schulze Fischer Becker and Elisabeth have been married since 1998. They are proud parents of 1 child: Neumann.
Education Background:
Schulze earned his secondary school diploma from Schiller-Gymnasium Berlin in 1980.
He then attended ISM Dortmund, which he graduated in 1986.
Occupation History:
Schulze Fischer Becker is a 62 year old retired Senior Designer from Germany. He has a diverse background, having worked in various capacities and gained extensive knowledge in the field.
In 1986, Schulze Fischer Becker started working as a Assistant Designer at Adidas AG, marking the beginning of his successful career.
His subsequent role was as a Senior Designer at Otto Group, where he continued to grow professionally from 1990 till retirement.
Wealth Summary:
He managed to save approximately 690000 EUR from his earnings at all companies.
He has townhouse located in Bochum, worth 1732000 EUR.

He purchased townhouse in Hamburg, where he spends his holidays. It is valued at 1504000 EUR.
On top of that he inherited a beautiful condo in Wuppertal, which could be used as a weekend getaway. It is valued at 1150000 EUR.
He does not have any inheritances.
Client Summary: The RM knows the client very well and is a good friend of the entire family.
